website_summaries.verdict: Choose this garden cart if you don't need or want a large, heavy model — it's just the right size and weight for hauling items for small backyard garden tasks.
pros: At a little over 6 pounds, this inexpensive cart is ideal for small items
Constructed of weather-resistant materials with a 15.5 gallon capacity
We love the telescoping handle that folds down easily when not in use
cons: Somewhat prone to tipping depending on how the weight of the items being transported is distributed

website_summaries.verdict: An ideal multi-purpose solution for those with reduced strength.
pros: Simple, lightweight, and low in cost

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is very handy for using in the yard and never hurts to have a little fun and give your grandkids a short ride!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Bought another, so useful, durable
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Bought a second one to use to bring my groceries from my car, up outdoor steps, and into house. Use first one for yard work and to brings firewood from woodshed directly into house. Holds as much as I can stuff into it. As another reviewer wrote, handle could be taller, but proportions work for shipping and assembly. No sharp corners, and no crevasses to clean. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: DebinNH

customer_reviews.title: Handy outdoor work cart
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a go for use as a muck cart at horse shows. The traditional muck cart and bucket costs five times more than this handy cart. I'm happy with my purchase. The only draw back with the chosen use...it can be a little awkward to dump at the manure pile, but I don't mind. It handles a lot of weight with ease and is durable. Again, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my cart!
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is the absolute best thing since sliced bread. I used it for spring flower bed clean out and vegetable garden clean out and it performed absolutely great. I am a 57 year old woman not in the best of shape and I can pick it up full of debris and empty it by myself. I love my little garden cart. I highly recommend it and I have nothing bad to say about it. I'm sure I will use it for years. Another use for it is to fill it with ice and beverages and use it for a party! You can wheel it wherever you want it to go.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Constantly tips over!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed. I’m 78, not very steady. I got the handles on ok. However, this constantly, and I mean all the time, tips over! It’s dangerous for me, as I could easily topple and break a hip or something. I can’t use this, will give it to ARC with a note explaining what it does. What a waste of money, time and effort! It’s a good size for me, was sure hoping it’d be good! Whoever designed this did a TERRIBLE job!
customer_reviews.author: F. Tague

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to tip out though
customer_reviews.text: Wheelbarrels are too heavy for my shoulder injury. This helps. Not as easy to tip out though, which is ok because what I do is put a lawn and yard bag in it and when it's full all I do is lift it out! And it rolls so much better on my gravel than a wheelbarrel.
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: Lawn cart works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Lawn cart works like it should. I will likely be hauling composted manure/potting mix/topsoil/grass/ and leaves with this lawn cart this new growing season. 5/5 stars! Here, I am hauling compost which I then amend into my garden soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect garden cart
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect garden cart and very fast and easy to put together...just 4 screws to attach the handle. My 2 year old granddaughter however has found a new use for it. She pulls her stuffed animals around in it and watches tv from inside. It will tip over when getting in and out but I don't think it's intended for that purpose. Very sturdy and solid for gardening chores.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Great garden bucket
customer_reviews.text: I love this little bucket. When I checked out wheelbarrows at the local hardware stores, they were way too big for my car and for storage in my garage. I do smaller-scale yard projects, and this does the trick. I've moved bricks, dirt, potted plants, ect. All you have to assemble is the handle, which only has 4 bolts to screw in. I would definitely recommend for someone that needs help moving things around their yard or workshop, but doesn't want/need to deal with a bulky, wide, more expensive wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Light weight compact cart. Easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Compact cart. Easy to store. Easier to handle than a wheel barrow. The cart is very light. Due to its light weight, if the cart is empty, it tends to fall over if it is not on a hard surface. When gardening, the cart would be on the grass, and until it was partially full, it kept falling backwards because that is where the weight of the metal handle is. The tipping could be fixed by just putting something in the cart, like a small rock or a brick, or hanging a small weight on the front.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mangi

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this cart as a muck bucket for my horse barn instead of the muck bucket that barns usually use. I really like this one because it is so light and is cheaper than the regular muck buckets, and carries just about as much as the other one. It is also easier to dump. I'm not sure how long the wheels will last, since they look like they are hollow plastic, but the value is good, and replacing the wheels when they need to be would not be very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Mevorah

customer_reviews.title: Love This Cart So Useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these three years ago and use it in my garden. I am thinking about buying another one or even 2 because they are so handy and the first one is usually has composted planting soil mix in it. I like to add my own nutrients to my planting soil for perennials customized for their needs. But this could be used indoors for so many things such as laundry, hauling trash bags to the curb, bringing groceries in, (easy to roll up a step or three) so lightweight, there are so many other uses. I think I will order another one soon. Writing this review has talked me into it.
customer_reviews.author: barbw

customer_reviews.title: Model LC1250D (this one) does NOT have a telescoping handle!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday. Box had the bin with wheels and one U-shaped handle and a package of nuts/bolts to affix handle. Another box (roughly 22X13X7) inside the 1st box...was empty. I thought they had forgotten to include the rest of the handle — the part that would make it 'telescoping'. I called the company, they said: "The telescoping lawn cart is model LCT125012. You have the LC1250D which has adjustable heights, but does not collapse." I'll probably keep it.....BUT...
customer_reviews.author: Ragout

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as easy to pull around as I was hoping when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as easy to pull around as I was hoping when it is full, maybe a little large wheel would help with that. It is still very handy to have around the yard and I find it much easier to use than a wheel barrow or just a bucket. It obviously doesn't dump like a wheel barrow would, so be sure you have an idea as to what you will be using it for. It also doesn't seem super durable but I think it is fine for the price, I paid around twenty and wouldn't recommend spending anymore than that.
customer_reviews.author: mom_of_three,teacher_of_many

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, practical and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is the second cart I have purchased. I and another person use it for grocery shopping because we don't have cars. If you are imagining this might work for whatever you need, you are probably right. I find it to be sturdy and practical and very versatile, and even though the price on the second cart went up $10, it is still a very good bargain for the money, and it looks like it will last for a long time. I've bought so many things on line that turn out to be a complete waste of money. This little cart exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Judith E. Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, but the Wheels are Made of Flimsy Plastic and Break
customer_reviews.text: The shape and usefulness of this product are clear. But the problem is the wheel system is built like a toy. The wheels are flimsy plastic that will easily break if you overload the cart or bounce a load over a rough surface. If they sold replacement wheels that might be tolerable. But once you break the wheels, the entire product becomes worthless. That is just a poor product design. One of my wheels did break, and now I have no way to fix the product.
customer_reviews.author: PoetryDude

customer_reviews.title: I love this so much
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much, we use it every day for something. We are very elderly and use it to bring in groceries from the car. We use it a lot for carrying cleaning supplies and garden supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Dwinskie

customer_reviews.title: Tipped over all the time In all Directions. Will ...
customer_reviews.text: Tipped over all the time In all Directions. Will not be able to use it. Had already thrown the box away so we are stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thing!
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need it to perfectly! I love that it is deeper than the usual yard carts which accommodates yard tools with longer handles such as hedge trimmers and short shovels without them falling out, yet wide enough that I can stack my trugs inside it. The handle - bolted at the lowest height option - is just the right height for a petite person and makes either pulling or pushing the contents with stability an easier task. Although I love the small footprint of this cart and find it very useful, I believe a slightly wider version could have additional benefits as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pat D.

customer_reviews.title: It's A Keeper!
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a big time saver, as I undertake a manual cleanup of my lawn in anticipation of a professional seeding next Spring. My first impression was a need to only attach the handle, as the wheels are already in place. The instructions are oddly coherent and the task could be handled by a child. I'll update as I put it to use. Today I rolled this around my lawn and collected various unwanted debris. It-along with the other tool in the photo-will save a lot of backaches!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, but Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Looked like this would be great for picking up garden waste or hauling planting material. And it is! But it is also very unstable and easily tips, spilling all the contents. Unless you have a perfectly level spot, you need to hold the handle to keep it from tipping. Of course, then you have only one hand to do whatever you wanted to do. If that's OK, buy it; if not, look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: wolfb

customer_reviews.title: Senior Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Its perfect for seniors or anyone who needs a wheelbarrow but cant maneuver one or even fill it. This cart is great PUSH or PULL...it is so sturdy you will think of many ways to use this. Hauling mulch bags or bags of potting soil. It is deep enough to effectively stand branches in . Wheels are large and easy to move, can move bricks or rocks and gravel, I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: GaylaS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that makes this not a prefect bucket is, it tips over with nothing in it. But, as a gardener, it is EASY to pull, loud and fits in my tiny garage! I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the average yard project!
customer_reviews.text: Holds a good amount of yard material and is a great help in getting all my materials to wherever I'm working in the yard. I bought this as a cheap alternative to a wheel barrow and I was not disappointed. It is sturdy enough to hold several shovels full of mulch, compost or whatever else I've thrown in it. Spray out to wash if you care about leftover yard scraps and dirt. Im taller than most so my only complaint is the handle is just a bit shorter than I had hoped so I didn't give it 5 stars. Will definitely purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am able to pick tons of fruits and use this cart to wheel it to work and share with co-workers. I have the metal handle raised to the highest notch possible, this does make the cart tip back if the cart is empty. To solve this tipping problem just lean it against something sturdy. To raise the handle or lower it will require removing the nuts and bolts and resetting each time. Would buy again love the quality
customer_reviews.author: True Blue

customer_reviews.title: Versitile
customer_reviews.text: Works well for this 73 year young grandma. Lightweight but sturdy. Use it to carry bricks and other heavy items. When working in the garden, pulling weeds, picking up leaves and yes--poop patrol; I place a large leaf/trash bag inside the cart. I can just take the bag out and toss into the trash can. If it had telescope handle, I'd give it 5 stars. My 4 year old granddaughter likes pulling it. Whenever we work outside, she's the one who offers to get the cart. Suncast hasn't disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: njsd

customer_reviews.title: Handle stays up
customer_reviews.text: The handle stays in one place. I thought that you could easily lower the handle but that isn’t so. You would have to totally unbolt the handle. The bucket is built sturdy and the wheels appear to work well inside. I haven’t tried outside.
customer_reviews.author: MsMgmt

customer_reviews.title: Great little Tote
customer_reviews.text: Great bucket. Way easy to assemble 4 screws 8 washers thats it 10 min Needed to haul logs 8lbs ea haul 10at a time So easy to maneuver better than 9 carrying 3 logs an making 5 trips Haul grocery bags easy. Goes easy over gravel drive an up to steps Made easier I put a ramp down not needed but easier for me as I’ m well into being a senior Price is excellent compared to others that would same
customer_reviews.author: Diambel

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I bought another! I use it to haul bird food to all my feeders scattered around the yard. Great for garden cleanup, too. In winter, I use it to haul hot water in jugs with caps to the birdbaths to melt the ice and refill. Saves my back and shoulder. Easy to maneuver. In winter, I make a shovel wide path through the snowy grass and it rolls easily. Love it, love it, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: Best yard helper ever
customer_reviews.text: I love my yard cart❣️ It is perfect for holding a few tools and the paper yard waste bags. I needed to get some large bags of potting soil and garden soil to the back yard and the patio deck and this has been the perfect answer. I’m in my upper 60’s and I was able to push, turn and pull with ease; even on the grass. I looked at many stores and online and this one got good reviews and was affordable. I recommend the Suncast yard cart.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I would love this, if the bolts had been included. I can’t attach the handle to the cart. Called support they closed for Covid( which I understand) However, I was requested to send an email . I sent the email and I have had no answer in 96 hours. Can’t use it without boots :-(
customer_reviews.author: D. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Gave it as Mother's Day Gift.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my mother because she loves to work outside in the yard. Since we are having to get grocery delivery right now and everything gets disinfected before bring brought into our house, this has been great for toting the groceries inside.
customer_reviews.author: JSquare

customer_reviews.title: My back thanks the inventors of this handy cart.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for a week but I love it. I bought it to bring wood from our bulkhead in the laundry room to our wood stove in the family room. It is just the right size to easily navigate around shelving, through doorways and around furniture so I don't have to make multiple trips carrying wood in the canvas tote anymore. The handle was easy to attach and seems very sturdy. With the capacity size, the large wheels, and the ease of navigation, I can envision many uses for it in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a new product and it arrived today with scratches on the handle that seemed to be covered in black marker. The handle has no way to be attached as parts were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great for hauling yard stuff, tools and debris.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for yard waste. I had previously purchased a Miracle Grow yard caddy that had the bottom break in several places after using twice for very light hauling. This is alot thicker plastic and seems to be VERY sturdy. I have already used it several times and it's holding up great. The point of weakness is probably where the handle screws in. But if you don't jerk it around it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for hauling lawn bags
customer_reviews.text: So far, I really love this cart. I use it mainly for hauling lawn bags up my steep side yard, but I also used it for hauling some landscape stones to the back yard. I didn’t fill it too full as it is plastic but it worked great! I also love that when I have a lawn bag in it there is still room along the side to fit my trimming shears and other yard tools so I can carry them all back up to the garage at once. My only complaint is that if not on a solid surface it tips forward pretty easy until there is some weight in it. Overall I’m very happy with this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Kym Hofman

customer_reviews.title: Purchased at full price.  Arrived Assembled
customer_reviews.text: The assembled cart and a smaller empty box (probably to prevent the cart from shifting), were in the shipping box. All you need to do is remove the 4 bolts, washers and wing nuts, raise the handle and reinsert them. A large flat screwdriver is needed. The empty cart is not balanced and tips backward. Just put it by a wall or tree. When using for lawn or garden debris, I put a cardboard box in the cart so I can empty it easier. Otherwise, you have to turn the cart upside down. My favorite discovery is that I can move my wide seat kneeler from place to place on top of the cart.
customer_reviews.author: LynnInColorado

customer_reviews.title: Good for level smooth applications
customer_reviews.text: Nice little cart that holds more than you think and can hold up to weight. It's perfect on level smooth ground but the hard tires make it less suitable for areas like rock driveways. I wish the handle was adjustable, it tends to be a little tippy on unlevel surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Dennis

customer_reviews.title: can use for ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: we bought this to help move things from the house to the camper when loading and unloading. but, you can use for anything. a party ice chest... move to the pool for fire pit... to help you in the garden, picking veggies, help you haul a bag of top soil to your plants... haul a grand kid in... I mean the possibilities are endless with this one!
customer_reviews.author: MCHammer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient for toting almost anything...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this a handy contraption! I use it to cart pitting soil, clean out the flower beds, clean my chicken coop, haul leaves, tote mulch, put all my hand gardening tools in, tote stuff from the car, tote trash to the big can outside, pull leaves and pine ones to my fire pit, haul charcoal from the shed to the pit, etc... it was easy to assemble, about 7 minutes. It is sturdy, thick molded plastic, easy rolling wheels and firm handle. Would buy this again in a heartbeat! Easy to clean, just rinse with a garden hose. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Hang DC le too short
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too short making you have to put it in up high leaving it fragile It is not steady. Too frahil
customer_reviews.author: Loetta Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and super handy
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately or maybe fortunately I ran over my heavy wheel barrow last winter. So I bought this in its place. I’m a small woman so I wanted something more light weight. This is perfect. I’ve used it for picking up sticks, hauling rocks around, and for picking up junk in my yard spring revealed. I’ll also use it for dirt for the garden. I have hilly property and it stays upright on an incline, which the wheel barrow did not do. It was easy to put together just 4 screws. I am really happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S.

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-use cart - very light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson as he had seen mine and thought he could use it in his yard. I bought mine to use when picking up sticks in my large yard after storms bring them down. However, I store it in my garage and use to load all my groceries from the trunk of my car to bring into house all in one trip. My disappointment was the price. I bought mine a couple of years ago at Aldis for $20. I paid $38 for this identical cart on Amazon. But I needed this for him for Christmas and he was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: OK - but NOT a heavy duty cart. For light duty use - very handy.
customer_reviews.text: OK - but NOT a heavy duty cart. To me this will be great for moving groceries and moving tools and few bags of soil. This IS NOT heavy duty at all. The image shows it full of ice. That would weigh well over 100 pounds. No way would I try to move 100 pounds in this - the metal arms are hollow lightweight steel, the wheels are hollow lightweight plastic and the bucket plastic is about the thickness of one layer of a cheapo cooler. Still a great deal and I am happy with it for what I will be using it for. Just be aware - this is no lawn cart - I have a few of those...
customer_reviews.author: Ed OsworthTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Basically a big bucket on wheels
customer_reviews.text: It's handy for some things, but the handle is a little too short IMHO (I'm 5' 6") and it's not for anything you want to dump out easily. It doesn't roll well over mulch or lumpy grass. And it tends to fall over backward when it's not full. Overall, if you want a big bucket on wheels, and you're not super tall, it could be just what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Suncast LC1250D 15.5-Gallon Capacity Poly... Suncast
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I bought another one. So lightweight, well-made, and easy to use. Allows me to move heavy loads of "stuff" around the house, the yard; back and forth from car (all my groceries come in the house in ONE trip); collect laundry from all around the house for ONE trip to the laundry room, and my list is growing :)
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Amazon since 1997

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This little cart has saved me SO MUCH work! My horses destroyed my wheelbarrow and I was looking for something to replace it. This was reasonably priced, so I decided to give it a try. I was not disappointed! It isn’t huge, but I have hauled everything from gravel to sod in it. Tools can be tossed it, as well. Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Fifteen gallon garden cart
customer_reviews.text: A handy small garden cart you can drag around with one hand while weeding or picking up pine cones with the other. The only drawback for me is the hand-hold on the bottom, intended for ease in dumping the load, is situated too far back to provide enough leverage to invert the cart. A hand-hold in front of the axle would work better.
customer_reviews.author: Genhund

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Super fast assembly. I can’t wait to start using this for my flower bed weeding . Very lightweight . I might buy another one ! I have a big yard so would be nice to have one in another area . Large enough for plenty of weeds & trimmings but not so big that it would be too heavy to lift for easy emptying.
customer_reviews.author: B. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: It’s light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Tips over unless there is something in it. Yays: I’m a 80 year old petite lady, I can fill this up and lift it to dump it into our yard waste bin. It’s easy to maneuver too. I put it together (handle) myself. I would recommend It to my friends. Love it. By the way, hubby has orders that it is only mine.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Kortlever-Kletke

customer_reviews.title: Great manure bin
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these. The oldest is 3.5 years, the youngest a little less than 3 years. Tonight I found one pretty much disintegrated. It had been holding a full load of horse manure for a week or more, inside my horse's stall. I'm assuming my horse broke it. That being said, I'm buying another one tonight. I absolutely love this cart! I had decided to try to find a muck bucket and wheeled carrier thingy and found that combo (holding less than this $30 item) costs around $100! The "muck buckets" are obviously better made...but, this inexpensive thing lasted around 3 years! You're darned right, I'm buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harmon

customer_reviews.title: A FABULOUS HELP!
customer_reviews.text: HAVE HAD TWO OF THESE FOR YEARS, JUST ADDED ONE MORE---PERFECT FOR CAR UNLOADING, GROCERY HANDLING, STORAGE ORGANIZING, "CLEAN" SORTING AND TRASH-TO-GO STUFF. WE USE OURS FOR INDOOR ITEMS ONLY---DRY PAPER, OVERNIGHT GUEST ITEMS, AND TOTING FROM ROOM TO ROOM OR UP THE STAIRS TO STORAGE! LOVE THEM! ROLL EASY! STAY CLEAN! In our particular case we are not using for garden carts, but for sure you can use them for just anything at all.! GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Friendly

customer_reviews.title: Great little light weight cart!
customer_reviews.text: Live this thing. It is just the right size for a bag of mulch or compost. Also, I am a Master Gardener, and sometimes need to volunteer at our beds at the fairgrounds. It is great to throw in the back of car and to put garden waste in to haul to garbage or composte bin. Fits through the service door in my garage too. Light enough to pick up easily. We would not overload or tax it or beat it up to much, but it is a very useful tool in my garden and volunteer work.
customer_reviews.author: BitoMom

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Constantly falls over which is very annoying to deal with. Not heavy enough on its own to stand up properly and is very awkward to use....... I would not buy again......
customer_reviews.author: Quinda Beeson

customer_reviews.title: Suncase helps Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Works just as planned. Helps me move heavy objects from one place to another. Senior citizens need to know about this. I can now get potting soil in the 2 cubic yard size. I can order a case of liquid beverage. Those Costco runs, that are so exhausting for those of us over 75? This thing really helps unload at home. Wouldn't be without it. Not only that, since it is pretty much weather-proof, I can store it in a protected outside area.
customer_reviews.author: Shari A. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Very poor packaging, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This cart was shipped from Suncast. I received it in a Suncast box that had several large holes punched in it. The screws and washers were just thrown in the (big) box, loose, not enclosed in plastic bags or any thing else. When we tried to assemble it there were two screws and a washer missing, apparently they had fallen out of the holes in the shipping process. Instead of going through the return process, we went to the hardware store and replaced the missing screws. The cart will suit our needs fine, seems fairly sturdy, but not for heavy duty use like cement blocks or even lots of bricks.
customer_reviews.author: misc.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Danger Cart!
customer_reviews.text: That was an ATHF reference. Anyway: + Price + Easy to Assemble + Sturdy + Good Capacity + Size Love this thing, great for transplanting bushes, moving dirt, cinder blocks, bricks, whatever. Very sturdy, I feel like I could keep beating it up for years with no damage. A different color would have been nice but that's not a big deal. My only concern was that when this was shipped, the box was totally smashed, like the first scene from Pet Detective. Doesn't take up too much space in my garage, I use it to hold camping chairs and stuff when I don't need to cart things around. Could probably also make a great cooler/ice bucket for a porch party.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is better than my old carts that I have used until they can't be used for anything but planters. I like the metal handle and think it will hold up better than the plastic ones. It is slightly bigger and square so it holds more. It hauls my chicken feed (50 lbs.) with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lefevere

customer_reviews.title: So versatile and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This garden cart is great! It can be lined with a bag for easy debris clean up; it can be used to move heavier items such as bags of soil to your planting location, or collect clippings as you work. Great design, steers easily even when fully loaded. Great for storing pruning implements in, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M

customer_reviews.title: 4 bolts and your ready to go
customer_reviews.text: I got this for moving a days worth of wood from the pile to the porch. It is perfect for how I intend to use it. It will also come in handy in the yard. I left off a star because it could have been built a little better, heaver plastic, nicer wheels etc. but I think it will work out fine me.
customer_reviews.author: FairweatherNine

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Garden Cart for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cart specifically to haul around mulch, soil and other items for my yard. The cart works great for that. It's not huge, but then if it was much bigger the load would be harder to move. It was easy to complete the handle assembly. The big wheels make it maneuverable over fieldstone slabs, gravel, mulch, etc. It stands well on its own, very stable, so once you get to where you are going you can shovel out your soil or mulch without worrying that it will tip over. When I priced wheelbarrows the cheapest ones were about 2X what I paid for this cart. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Elanor

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. No screws or bolts to attach the handle were included!! I will get my own since that’s easier than the return but not feeling confident about the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Cranmer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this so we can more easily move dirt/mulch/compost in the garden
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so we can more easily move dirt/mulch/compost in the garden. It's worked perfectly for this purpose. Some other reviews state that the handle is adjustable, but the one that I received (shipped by Amazon and delivered April 28, 2018) comes with a handle that can not be adjusted up or down. Don't have any issues with the height of the handle, and the product description does not state that the handle is adjustable, so not docking any stars for that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect answer but unperfect product assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, we ordered this to tote laundry back and forth from the clothesline. I love it and it is perfect for that. However, it arrived in a box with the bottom assembled so all you needed to do was attach the handles. But it wouldn't roll correctly. After looking it over we discovered that one wheel was attached incorrectly. We had to go to the hardware store and buy another piece, pry the post free and reattach the wheel. I feel like we should get a refund. Why in the world was that done to this wheel?
customer_reviews.author: James Haney

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me out of the chiropractor's office
customer_reviews.text: I wonder why I have't bought this product before now. I use it to move everything, as well as holding my weed sprayer when I am after those pesky weeds. It is strong, easy to maneuver around the yard, and perfect for a weakling like me who enjoys working outside. It has changed my life and what I am able to do without hiring a helper.
customer_reviews.author: Verny55

customer_reviews.title: Handy, sturdy bin
customer_reviews.text: I got this bin to use for shrub clippings and weeds. There is no assembly required; just loosen the lug nuts to extend the handle. Used it immediately for distributing mulch in my side yard. It is easy to roll, even on uneven surfaces and held up well for this job. It was a little cumbersome to dump the mulch out of the bin, (nothing to grab on sides or bottom), but still worked very well for me. The bin is a little smaller than I had anticipated, but that actually makes it easier to move around the yard. It also does not take up a lot of space in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Great product for budget
customer_reviews.text: Decent product for the money. Bought it to move dirt and bricks from front yard to back yard. Works well. Minor complaint is handle height and it would benefit from bigger wheels to go over grass but i wouldn't expect anything more from a product this price. Works for my landscaping projects.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Z

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little cart. I use it for gardening and for hauling groceries into the house from the garage. It was so easy to assemble and lightweight. I even used it to haul bags of bark from the vehicle to the yard. It goes easily over rocks, dirt, smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: willie

customer_reviews.title: Great cart for carrying groceries!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cart. I use it to unload groceries from my vehicle so I do not have to carry heavy bags or make several trips back and forth to get my groceries into the house. I have arthritis so this is very helpful to me. Loaded up it easy to pull. Prior to this I was using a wagon but this is easier to manouver thru my gate and doorway than the wagon.
customer_reviews.author: Legallyn

customer_reviews.title: A great buggy for my baby!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this new yard-buggy is like a buddy to me, for my wife is happier when working in our yard! It truly is an excellent and practical device for using outside for planting things or for cleaning debris. It appears to be exactly like our old one that perished after a couple of decades.
customer_reviews.author: Lynchburg Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Y to he wheel barrel is for my wife. She loves it. It’s very easy to to move around. It’s the perfect size to fit under her compose bin. She’s already got a lot of use out of it. It’s the best for her needs and she would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Janes

customer_reviews.title: Good tote
customer_reviews.text: Great cart just perfect for toting around 2 sprayers to take care of fruit trees and vegetable garden. I am older, small woman and do not like carrying the weight of those things. This is also handy for carrying a bunch of gardening supplies, fertilizer etc out to the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for cane users
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely handy product. I have recently developed a problem that requires me to use a cane. This makes it difficult to carry every-day largish loads - especially things like unloading groceries. This is perfect for that task.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo

customer_reviews.title: Great for old lady gardener
customer_reviews.text: I can't use a wheelbarrow -- too heavy and hard to steer. This little cart is perfect for me -- I can pull it behind me with one hand -- it just trots along without wavering or turning over. It does get very dirty of course. I'm thinking of getting another one to keep clean and use to bring my groceries in.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cubberley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this little wheelbarrow/cart. I use it to move rocks and dirt or to haul leaves. It’s saved me so much time with cleaning my back yard of my new house. I’m only 5ft and find it’s easy to push or pull. It only tips over if it’s empty and not on a level surface. It’s not been an issue for me. I love it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CyndeeZ

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It came without bolts to put the arms on. And it came late.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ringle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and decided to try it for myself... love it!! Super quick and easy to put together.. easy to handle, carriers everything I need to haul.. cleans up easily..and looks nice sitting in the yard when it doesn't get put away. Much easier on my back than standard wheelbarrow and much easier to control.. no accidental tip overs! I join those who are great fans of this wheelbarrow!
customer_reviews.author: adrianne hurtig

customer_reviews.title: Great cart
customer_reviews.text: In order to get 5 stars for maneuverability the wheels would have to be larger, but this cart is very easy to assemble and use. I am going to use it for mixing up bloom booster with aged manure and spreading onto blooming bushes
customer_reviews.author: CheckAmazonFirst

customer_reviews.title: Rolling rolling rolling
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made utility cart. Handle is easily adjustable. It rolls easily. Just put a 24 pack of coke in it and rolled it up the stairs. The coke did have to go in sideways, not that big of a cart. People have said that they use it often for groceries, they must be using those plastic bags because it would not really work with a paper bag. Only one bag would fit at a time. But it moved well. Primarily bought this to use in the garden for peat moss, topsoil, etc. But that will have to wait until the spring.
customer_reviews.author: James G

customer_reviews.title: Great for disabled people to carry groceries or trash around.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This roomy & lightweight cart is just the ticket for hauling heavy groceries in, and trash out. Some of the best money I ever spent. If you're like me & have a problem with walking & lifting, give this a try. Just wish it would fit all through my house; I'd buy another! Great cart!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Milford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for me to use in the yard when I pull weeds. This came and I was easily able to put the pull handle in place. It is the perfects size. When I get it full I can easily lift it and empty it into our green barrel. Appears durable.
customer_reviews.author: traveler530

customer_reviews.title: JUST A GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE MINIATURE HORSES AND USE THIS AS MY MANURE BUCKET, IT HANDLES EASILY, DUMPS EASILY AND I CAN CLEAN 4 STALLS WITH ROOM LEFT. PERFECT PRODUCT FOR WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR AS REGULAR WHEEL BARROWS GET TO HEAVY TO PUSH AROUND. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: IMPRESSION

customer_reviews.title: Awsome cart!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart to move my gardening tools and soil around the yard. I was afraid it might be too small, but it is perfect! I loaded 3 bags of pottong soil, 12 plants and my tools! When it started to rain I just rolled everything under my grill gszebo.Instead of 3 trips to my shed i do it all in one trip now! I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Janey

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I love my little cart. I used it in the yard for hauling potting soil, tools, etc. After purchasing I bought a small lawn tractor with a dump cart so now my little helper will be placed in my trunk to assist in shopping, placing groceries in it to wheel inside once I'm home. It's very sturdy, not large but for the price meets my expectations and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Carol J

customer_reviews.title: Great for lightweight items
customer_reviews.text: Good for transporting lightweight items - the handle will crack the plastic if the weight is too high. If you have a sloping yard then be very attentive to the weight load.
customer_reviews.author: renegadetraderTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful small cart!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small cart to go in the rather narrow paths of my flower garden and this cart is perfect. It is light weight and rolls well on dirt, gravel and cement! I am an 81 year old gardener and I love it. I can easily see why others value it for interior use with groceries and laundry. I expect it to outlast me!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I use this for when weeding the garden, yard and transplanting. Works great for that. I get a ton of weeds . Was always borrowing neighbors wheel barrow. This was not expensive. Easy to put together. Carries what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size and convenience, not the sturdiest
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my constant gardening and pruning, and it's been awesome. But I would note that is not incredibly sturdy. I wouldn't fill this with gravel or dirt and expect it to last for that purpose, you'd want a proper wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart !
customer_reviews.text: I use this cart between my car and kitchen for groceries.I hate carrying too many bags into the house at once by hand or making multiple trips . I just pull it behind me and guide the wheels up my porch steps .I don’t know if that will work for people weaker than myself though.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Tree container
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these containers. I use them for planting trees that need to be moved into the garage during the winter and moved outside in the spring. I simply have a few holes drilled into them for drainage , put some large rocks into the bottom and proceed to plant my trees. They roll easily enough that I am able to move the plants without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product for outside.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but much wider than I expected. My fault. I’m sure it says somewhere in the description how wide it is. I missed it. Very wide.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR EVERY HOSEHOLD PERFECT SIZE
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this handy little cart 100 stars for carrying almost everything: groceries amazing how many bags you can get in the cart, wood for wood burning stoves, outside gardening--it washes clean in a minute or you can just wipe it out in a jiffy. Goes up and down stairs and across the lip of the door entry very easily. I wouldn't be without it, it's light, rugged and wheels are good.
customer_reviews.author: Drama Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: It works very well for my needs. I keep it in the garage; when I return with groceries, I can fill this cart and pull it into the house, up 2 steps to the kitchen. Everything is done in one trip which saves time.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Vegtable Planter on weheels
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this years ago - it follows me wherever I go in the yard - endless uses - If you are looking for a multi-use garden cart this is it. Bought this at aldi's for $20.00. I bought 3 - plant tomatoes in them and cart them to wherever the sun in - husband drilled holes in the bottom - shelter them from bad storms - absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Marie

customer_reviews.title: not well-made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband. We used it 2 days ago. There was no hole for one of the screws we have. Other than that problem, the cart is very handy and holds a lot. Wish it was made better but it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shopperjo

customer_reviews.title: We use alot
customer_reviews.text: Great for apt living. We pull trash to dumpsters. Helps with balance when you are older and trash get heavier. Good find. We sometimes use to bring groceries in when they are heavy. Cat litter, sodas, tea, Milk etc.
customer_reviews.author: bea

customer_reviews.title: Use this frequently doing yard work.
customer_reviews.text: Use this frequently when doing yard work. A better alternative to those heavier, hard-to-manage wheel barrels. It's held up very well. Good value all around.
customer_reviews.author: Laurene Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little helper.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the fact that I can pick this up and dump my yard debris into recycle containers. It does tend to fall backward when empty but I just prop the cart up against something. I also empty a large bag of mulch or compost or potting soil and roll it where I need to use it. I store it in my basement to keep contents dry. I’m getting lots of use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: flowering florence

customer_reviews.title: How did I garden before getting one of these?
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this can't be beat. If you garden and don't already have one, you'll definitely want this. Its great for hauling soil, mixing soil, carrying heavy tools, etc. I'm a rather small woman doing all the gardening myself, so this cart is my lifesaver! I don't know how I got along without it for so long! Your back will thank you! The quality won't be beat!! I've used mine regularly since I got it a month ago and it still practically looks new. I'll update if my opinion changes or if something happens, but I'm a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Grace

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hand Cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same cart 3 years ago from a local store. It is the perfect size for using for numerous tasks in and out of the house. I keep it in the garage to put my bags of groceries in so I only have to make 1 trip into the house. We also use it to bring firewood into the house during the winter months. Extremely handy for gardening/landscaping needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Picker

product_meta.title: Suncast 2-Wheel Resin Multi-Purpose Cart with Handle - 15.5 Gallon Cart for Garden, Grocery Store and Home - Brown
product_meta.description: Suncast's 2 Wheel Garden Cart is the perfect solution for your storage and transportation needs throughout the home and yard. Use the cart indoors to move groceries and laundry, or outdoors for firewood wood chips and more. The utility cart provides a spacious 15.5-gallon holding capacity and measures 20" x 22" x 34". It is built from durable and lightweight resin, and includes a telescoping handle for easy use. The 7-inch wheels are optimized for smooth and reliable rolling on a variety of surfaces. Assembly is a breeze with no tools required for setup.
feature_bullets: 2-WHEEL ROLLING CART: Lightweight rolling lawn cart with a 15.5-gallon is the perfect transportation tool for a wide variety of items in your home and garden
VERSATILE: Use both indoors and outdoors to transport groceries from the car, laundry up the stairs in your home or dirt and mulch throughout your yard
DURABLE: Constructed from heavy-duty resin plastic, this utility cart is built to last for years of quality use
TELESCOPING HANDLE: The handle extends for comfort and compatibility across most users
HASSLE FREE ASSEMBLY: No tools are required for quick and easy assembly

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,444 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
